comments:
Eclipse Version : Eclipse 3.0 M6 HPUX (9000/motif) version

JDK Version : java version "1.4.1.00"
              Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition 
              (build 1.4.1.00-030116-09:58)
              Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 1.4.1 1.4.1.00-030116-11:27-   
              PA_RISC2.0 PA2.0, mixed mode)
 

After installing this build, I tried executing eclipse and resulted in the 
following error in my log file. I tried the various options which various 
people in the newsgroup suggested like deleting .config folder or providing -vm 
arguments in the command line. 

Somebody has suggested installing this eclipse in the root user. But I could 
not buy the argument as everyone will not get the super user password in an HP-
UX box or any box for that matter. Is there any work around for this problem? 
Is it a bug?

Exception that appears in the log file:

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 17, 2004 19:47:55.774
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application service
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:84)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:279)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:742)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:581)


Thanks & Regard
Balasubramaniyan K

This is probably a duplicate of bug 44487 (a bug in the HP VM). A clearer error
message is available since 3.0 M7.

Please try the workaround described in bug 44487 comment 2. Reopen this bug if
it does not solve your problem.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 44487 ***
